reviewText: First off, if you love Scissor Sisters, this is definintely a must. It is a very revealing (in more ways than one) look at the band, both on stage, and through documentary and videos. The concert itself is outlandish. At 78 minutes, the band is in great form, and the sound of the dvd itself is great (there are three options: 5.1 Dolby, DTS, and 2.0). For this price alone, a must for every fan.If you are not a fan, but like what you may have heard on the radio, you may very well be after seeing this. The band is truly fun loving, and anything goes on this dvd, and usually does.The much rumoured easter eggs on the dvd can be found easilly if you have title access on your dvd player (check out title 14 for one that gives new meaning to the word revealing).All in all a great companion to the cd.
summary: Out There In The Best Possible Way

reviewText: I love the Scissor Sisters and have been anxiously awaiting them to become big stars here in the USA as they are in the UK.For a great price you get videos of their hits, a concert, and interviews.  What more can you ask for.  Oh, the music is fantastic!

reviewerName: Duane Simolke "author, The Acorn Stories, Deg...
reviewText: Despite the fact that their debut album provides their entire play list, Scissor Sisters manage to deliver a DVD collection that includes a full-length concert, several music videos, a documentary, and much more! This DVD reportedly includes some Easter eggs as well, for those with the patience or equipment to find that sort of thing.The picture quality during the concert falters at times, but the sound quality is perfect, and that really matters the most in this case. Fans of this theatrical dance band will enjoy seeing how they interpret these already familiar songs on stage. Keep in mind that singer Jake Shears previously worked as a go-go dancer; or just think of Queen's Freddy Mercury with just as much peacock attitude but even more energy! All of the members bring their unique personalities to the show and the music. The ending number goes so far over the top that it seems like the Muppets crashing a live performance of The Rocky Horror Picture Show!The music videos capture the humor and energy of the band in other ways, allowing them to play with costumes, low-budget special effects, and silly plot lines. The documentary goes a long way in explaining the bizarre antics but immediate magnetism of this hot new band.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Scissor Sisters DVD: We are the Scissor Sisters and So Are You! is just what the doctor ordered.On the disc are the following:- It has a full concert of this dynamic and outlandish group- All of their current videos- Interviews with the group- Background info on the group and its members, including how they got started as a group- All sorts of other really fun stuff including at least one easter egg which is footage of lead singer Jake Shears getting dressed - in other words, you see Jake in his birthday suit!For those of us a bit older who remember when MTV actually played videos (and non-rap videos at that) we yearn for this type of DVD.The group is outlandish and entertaining.This DVD is really great - go get it!
summary: An Absolute Must For Fans of this Awesome Group!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Jake Shears is just about the sexiest and cutest singer I've ever seen. With his pin-up looks, hauntingly gorgeous piercing eyes, and talent, he was born to be a rock star. And his amazing vocal range sounds even better live. His go-go dancer antics fuse the intensity as does his tight body and revealing costumes. This debut DVD from the best new band to hit the scene this decade is packed with great stuff! The concert itself is mesmerizing, theatrical, and sounds more rock and roll than their increadible debut album.The dvd menu is spectacular, with nice graphics and a fresh layout. Not only do you get the concert, but you also get 5 of their music videos,a documentary, and more.This is one of the finest and most exciting dvd presentations of a band in concert, and a great way to get to know this awesome band. Can't wait till they tour the U.S. this year!
Title: N/A

I hear they don't sell a zac in America their home country EH!!! Where's your taste you people buy this DVD and discover one of your finest exports.I love it highly recommended!!!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Perhaps it's a generation thing, because I think I would be more enthusiastic about this band if I were in my 20's instead of my 40's.  I do think that their cover of Pink Floyd's "Comfortably Numb" is amusing and a couple of their other songs are catchy.  Co-lead singiner Ana Matronic comes across as interesting in the many interview clips here, but it's strange that there's so little in the way of interview footage with Jake Shears.I assume that many people like this band because they are flamboyant, outrageous, and Jake Shears is cute.  Hey, the band obviously knows what a lot of fans want -- Ana talks about Jake's go-go boy past and even compares him, on stage, to hustlers in Times Square pre-Guiliani days.  They've even included an "easter egg" on the dvd in which the viewer can see Jake in the buff.  And it isn't even necessary to look for hidden footage to see Jake's backside in all its glory as the dvd offers many glimpses of that.I may have given this dvd 4 stars instead of 3 if the video quality wasn't so poor.  The main program (the concert) has A LOT of pixelation throughout.  Apparently they used a low budget digital camera that could not resolve fast moving shots and shots where the contrast changes too quickly.  And some of the music videos themselves offer far lower resolution than consumer grade VHS machines.  I know that this band isn't big in the United States, but one would think that for a band that is selling millions of records in Europe could afford to make their videos with better equipment.  This dvd, by far, contains some of the worst looking videos I have seen.
summary: fun but doesn't live up to the hype; bad video quality
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was SCREAMING with laughter when I caught this segment on the Return To Oz band documentary. Ana Matronic is killing me! HA HA! This is a FABULOUS dvd (and CHEAP!). As if the cd weren't incredible enough, this release has a marvelously directed live film (love the opening Dolly Parton track; love the stage finale), terrific videos, a killer track playing when you select "Songs" on the menu, and other great, great stuff. The sound mixes are AWESOME, played over a home theater setup. The menus are very creative (especially Ana Matronic and Jake Shears' dances) and unlike many music dvds, this one is presented in ANAMORPHIC 16:9 WIDESCREEN! Terrific!!!
summary: "God is just a stuffed animal for the adults"
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ahhh the Scissor Sisters.  What could I say.  If you haven't heard of this band or like them, then I say, be a little more open and try again.  The facade of the band is totally homoerotic (and i say that with full respect of the band)  and it might turn off sensitive viewers or closed minded individuals, but if seeing the band is too much I encourage people to listen to their music at least because the music is FANTASTIC!!  It is an absolute kickback to the BeeGees, Elton and other 70's glam disco acts, and though that might seem old or done or out there, you really have to hear this band.  It makes you want to go out and have a good time and sing along or dance or just plain feel good, smile and LIVE it up no matter what you do and who doesn't love that.  My only negative as with all live music videos is that they don't play one of my favorite Scissor Sisters tracks, "Ooh".
summary: ".. and if the music ain't good, well it's just too bad, we're gonna sing along no matter what.."
Title: N/A
